definition: half of sth/one side of sth
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
suffix of a noun of locality
half the sky/women of the new society/womenfolk
Woman can hold up half the sky/fig. nowadays, women have an equal part to play in society
pinyin: fu4 nu:3 neng2 ding3 ban4 bian1 tian1

sentences.english: Shigeo Tokuda is a very famous celebrity in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 德田重男是一位红透半边天的日本名人。

sentences.english: Cones in each half of the retina are adapted to produce different light-filtering pigments.
sentences.chinese: 每半边视网膜上的锥体能够产生不同的光过滤颜色。

sentences.english: Aim To study the effect of 5F on tubulin polymerization.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究半边旗提取物5F对微管蛋白聚合的影响。

sentences.english: Women can hold up half the sky.
Half the sky burns red, pressing heavily down upon the bald head of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 半边天烧红了，重甸甸地压在夕阳的光头上。

sentences.english: Ten ancient city of Pingyao strange, one of which is the house half of the cover.
sentences.chinese: 平遥古城十大怪，其中之一就是房子半边盖。

sentences.english: The toothache puffed out one side of his face.
sentences.chinese: 牙痛使他的半边脸肿了起来。

sentences.english: And women in China have taken an important place in the fight to preserve the environment in their own country.
sentences.chinese: 今天，中国妇女已经顶起了中国环境保护的半边天。

sentences.english: He cupped his cheek swelled by toothache.
sentences.chinese: 他用手捂着因牙痛而肿胀的半边脸。

sentences.english: Today women make up about half of the total number of competitors.
sentences.chinese: 如今，女选手大约占据了参赛选手总人数的半边天。

sentences.english: Lobelia is Campanula half lotus plants Lobelia sessilifolia Lamb with the whole grass roots.
sentences.chinese: 山梗菜是桔梗科半边莲属植物山梗菜的带根全草。

sentences.english: One side of her mouth pulled in, and she shrugged with one shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她抿着半边嘴唇，耸着一只肩膀。

sentences.english: North American wild lobelia having small blue flowers and inflated capsules formerly used as an antispasmodic.
sentences.chinese: 北美野半边莲，开蓝色小花，以前充入胶囊里作。

sentences.english: Its ears hung down , big enough to cover half its face.
sentences.chinese: 它两耳耷拉着，大得能盖住半边脸。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
a portion smaller than a half/the lesser part/the smaller part
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
